message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.LG

The paper deals with the problem of efficient allocation of transmission resources for small data packets in future communication systems. This problem is related to information theory (cs.IT), network infrastructure (cs.NI), signal processing (cs.SI), multimedia (cs.MM), and machine learning (cs.LG). The proposed scheme involves block precoding, sparsity-aware recovery, and interference cancellation, which are techniques commonly used in these sub-categories. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.IT, cs.NI, and cs.SI, followed by cs.MM and cs.LG.
